line_1: Let thy lov'd hand with palm and am'ranth strew
line_2: Let one superior scene attract my view,

line_1: Before his lighten'd steps thy pleasures strew,
line_2: And place thy train of virtues in his view;

line_1: Earth o'er these limbs her dust shall strew,
line_2: No more the sun these eyes shall view,

line_1: Vapid Content her poppies round thee strew,
line_2: Whilst to the bliss of TASTE thou bidst adieu!

line_1: Upon my grave shall other maidens strew.
line_2: And richer flowers of vivid hue

line_1: Some chosen leaves your peaceful walks shall strew.
line_2: Shall all unfold their choicest sweets for you.

line_1: No kindly hand does there sweet flow'rets strew.
line_2: Each future prospect darkens on my view;
